subject: Re: [junit] Re: splitting this list
msgSnippet: No problem. There will always be a few folks who are not yet used to the etiquette and protocols of the mailing lists. It happens; been there and done that
messageBody:
No problem. There will always be a few folks who are not yet used to
the etiquette and protocols of the mailing lists. It happens; been
there and done that myself. I think the biggest issue was with folks
who signup on the mailing list and ask "What is JUnit?" Now, that's a
valid question, but I think the thought was to provide a list for that
kind of question, so that it didn't disturb the flow of the "How do
I?" questions.

My thought is that if we carefully point these folks at the available
documentation on junit.org and suggest reviewing ESR's Smart Question
essay, that they'll either give up when they see that some personal
effort is involved or they'll appreciate the help and start becoming
productive members of the JUnit community.

I also agree with J.B.'s point, that some of these people are the
experts of a couple of years from now. You know, Mike Clark isn't
getting any younger, so we need to find and train his replacement as
soon as possible! ;-)

Simon

--
www.simonpeter.com

On 9/21/05, Lis <lisfolks@...> wrote:
> I signed up for this list - after finding it in a web search - a
> couple of days ago. I had no idea I'd receive a FAQ after signing
> up. Therefore, if I'd had a question to ask at that time, I probably
> would've asked it without thinking about it. If I weren't familiar
> with Yahoo! Groups, I probably wouldn't have thought to check the
> message archives beforehand, either. I'm glad it happened to work
> out that I didn't end up being one of the people this thread is
> about! What a welcome it would've been!
>
> Thanks for providing the list, anyway, 'cause it looks interesting so
> far.
>
> -- LeAnne
>
>
> On Sep 21, 2005, at 5:00 PM, Simon Chappell wrote:
>
> > I can tell you that when I switched to using my gmail address for this
> > mailing list (after deciding to discontinue using my employers email
> > address for mailing lists), that I *did* receive a copy of the FAQ.
> >
> > Simon
> >
